intro: Arabis nova, commonly known as the New Zealand rock白菜, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant features basal leaves that are rosette-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Arabis nova is typically found in rocky or alpine habitats and is adapted to cool, moist environments.
